result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Earnest Harris III

defendant.name: Harris, Earnest, III

records.addlTxt: Hearing on December 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:10 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defendant Earnest Harris III appeared by Zoom, in custody at Oakhill Correctional.  Attorney Cassandra A Miller Ms. in court for Earnest Harris III. 

The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. 
Waive reading of Information. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
THE DEFENDANT IS CURRENTLY INCARCERATED AT OAKHILL CORRECTIONAL, HOW THE DEFENDANT APPEARS AT THE NEXT COURT DATE WILL BE LEFT UP TO THE DISCRETION OF THE TRIAL COURT.
Hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

9:15 AM Defendant Earnest Harris III not in court, in custody at Oakhill Correctional.  Attorney Cassandra A Miller Ms. in court for Earnest Harris III.  Attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Miller states that the Defendant was not produced from Oakhill and requests an adjournment. 
The State does not object.
The Court will set the matter for Status of Prelim.
THE COURT ORDERS THE DEFENDANT TO APPEAR VIA ZOOM FROM OAKHILL CORRECTIONAL FOR THE NEXT HEARING.
Hearing scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Oak Hill Correctional Institution

1:46 PM Defendant Earnest Harris III appeared by video from Oak Hill Correctional, in custody. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Nikki Kane. State Public Defender's Office Law Intern appeared for the defense by Eric Schluter. 
Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Oak Hill Correctional unless a waiver is filed.  Bail remains as fixed. Preliminary time limits waived.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: appointing Attorney Cassandra Miller
Hearing on September 15, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

2:49 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defendant Earnest Harris III appeared by Zoom, in custody, at the Oakhill Correctional. 

The Court calls the matter for the Status of Counsel.
The Defendant states he has not contacted the SPD as he was not given the SPD number.
The Court will toll the time limits and adjourn the matter.
THE COURT ORDERS THE DEFENDANT TO APPEAR VIA ZOOM FROM OAKHILL CORRECTIONAL.
Hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Detainer Acknowledgement
Status conference on August 18, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Detainer placed at: Oakhill Correctional Institution
Fax Confirmation and returned fax
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with any Walmart Store.

03:24 PM Defendant Earnest Harris in court by zoom video, in custody at Oakhill Correctional.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Defendant has not been in contact with the public defender's office.  Defendant's mandatory release date 4/2023.  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

08:38 AM Defendant Earnest Harris appeared by Zoom, in custody, from Oakhill Correctional.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes the defendant is able to hear us but we cannot hear him.  The Court will adjourn initial appearance and make arrangements for the defendant to appear by Zoom from Oakhill Correctional at the next hearing.  Initial appearance scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Initial appearance on July 7, 2022 at 08:15 am.
